{newline}{newline}WARNING: Your army will lose the selected leader if they're a member and any member parties you select. You will remain the leader of the old army.
Are you sure you want to disband your army?
Are you sure you want to disband this army? This will result in relation loss.
This action is disabled while in a mission.
You can not perform this action while the army is in a siege.
You can not perform this action while the army is in a map event.

Mercenaries are contracted by another kingdom.
Can only extend contracts with less than one {LENGTH} remaining.
You cannot hire mercenaries while they're in a map event.
Mercenaries are not under contract.
Only rulers can terminate mercenary contracts.
You cannot manage your own contract.
You cannot manage contracts while a target clan party is in a map event.
Are you sure you want to {EXTEND} contract with this mercenary? This will result in a non-refundable up-front cost.
Are you sure you want to terminate the contract with this mercenary? You will not receive a refund.

Contract Cost

{=xg0izQ4X}{HOUR} {?HOUR_IS_PLURAL}hours{?}hour{\?}
This army will be more inclined to take defensive actions against enemies such as responding to enemy raids and sieges.
This army will be more inclined to take offensive actions against enemies such as raiding and besieging.
Maintain Cohesion
Automatically maintains cohesion for this army using player influence
Insufficient influence to maintain cohesion for army: {ARMY}
Daily Influence Change: {CHANGE}{INFLUENCE_ICON}
You must leave the party before becoming it's new leader.
Modify Winter Warfare Tendency (EXPERIMENTAL)
Decreases the chance of war decisions in winter based on total calculating trait levels of proposer and ruler. Default: Disabled
Mercenary Contract Type
The mercenary contract length. Effects the contract cost as it is relative to daily wages. Default: Seasonal
Mercenary Contract Gold Cost Multiplier

Multiplier for the costs when hiring a mercenary. The total contract cost is calculated by multiplying the total daily cost of mercenary party wages and the amount of days the mercenary will be contracted for. WARNING: If they aren't paid enough to at least cover troop wages, they may not properly feed their troops as well as having other side effects. Default: 1.25
Faction Leaders Can Call Mercenary To Army Without Cost
Allows the faction leader to call mercenaries to their army without a cost. Default: Enabled
Cost Multiplier To Call Mercenary To Army
The cost multiplier to call a mercenary party to an army. Default: 1.0
Call Mercenary To Army Cost Type
The cost type to call a mercenary party to an army. Default: Denars
Enable Cohesion Change
Allows cohesion to be depleted over time. Default: Enabled
Daily Cohesion Change Multiplier
The multiplier to the vanilla daily change in cohesion for armies. Default: 1.0
Minimum Wars To Hire Mercenaries
The minimum amount of wars for AI clans to hire mercenaries. Default: 1
Spawn Additional Mercenaries

Spawns more mercenaries when starting a new game than vanilla includes. This will make the world livelier and give more contract possiblities. The mod is balanced around this being enabled. Default: Enabled
Maintain Vanilla Names

When the vanilla mercenary clans are spawned in a new game, they will use vanilla naming conventions. By default, this mod renames them to maintain consistency with additionally spawned mercenaries. The additional mercenaries will maintain Warfare naming conventions. Default: Disabled
Maintain Vanilla Banners

When the vanilla mercenary clans are spawned in a new game, they will use vanilla banners. By default, this mod shuffles them to maintain consistency with additionally spawned mercenaries. The additional mercenaries will maintain Warfare banner conventions. Default: Disabled
Enable Modify Maximum Battlefield Agents
Allows the maximum battlefield agents modifier to be set using the mod, which overrides the vanilla setting which ranges from 200-1000. Default: Disabled
Maximum Battlefield Agents

Sets the maximum number of total agents on battles. NOTE: Setting this too high can result in crashes! It is recommended to test a field battle using lots of cavalary if you plan to set this higher than 1000. Overrides the Battle Size setting in the vanilla Performance settings section. Default: 500
Modify Army Besiege AI

Modifies the army besieging AI to prevent AI armies from moving to siege a settlement already being besieged by another army. This minimizes the chance of a player siege being taken over by an AI. There will tend to be multiple war fronts / theaters with this enabled. Default: Enabled
Minimum Fiefs To Modify Army Besiege AI
Modifies the army besieging AI only if the target faction has at least the specified number of fiefs. This has no effect if 'Modify Army Besiege AI' is Disabled. Default: 3
Time To Prevent Army Besiege AI (Hours)

Sets the amount of time in hours that the AI will be prevented from attempting to besiege a settlement being besieged by another army. This has no effect if 'Modify Army Besiege AI' is Disabled. Default: 24
Defensive tendency for defensive Army Strategy
Sets the defensive tendency for armies using the defensive strategy. Default: 110%
Offensive tendency for defensive Army Strategy
Sets the offensive tendency for armies using the defensive strategy. Default: 65%
Chase tendency for defensive Army Strategy
Sets the party chase tendency for armies using the offensive strategy. Default: 120%
Defensive tendency for offensive Army Strategy
Sets the defensive tendency for armies using the offensive strategy. Default: 65%
Offensive tendency for offensive Army Strategy
Sets the offensive tendency for armies using the offensive strategy. Default: 110%
Chase tendency for offensive Army Strategy
Sets the party chase tendency for armies using the offensive strategy. Default: 80%
Enables logs for testing and reporting purposes. Enable this only if Author requests a log during issue reproduction. Default: Disabled
